ads1115.description: This is an alternative PiFire module supporting the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC.  This module is no longer the default due to reports of issues.  If you experience trouble with this module, try the Adafruit modules.  There has been rumors of sellers shipping ADS1015 12-Bit ADC's instead of the ADS1115 16-Bit ADC's.  If you got one of these, you can try the 1015 library instead.

ads1015_adafruit.description: This module supports the ADS1015 12-Bit ADC based on Adafruit's Circuit Python implementation/module.  This version can also be used with the ADS1115, as it is backward compatible.  Some fidelity may be lost due to the fact that the ADC has less bits to measure with, however in testing it seems to be reasonably good.  Use this if you are having issues with the default ADS1115 module.

ili9341e.friendly_name: ILI9341 TFT with Rotary Encoder Input (standard)
ili9341e.description: The ILI9341 TFT Display Module LCD Screen is an affordable, popular display with a 320x240 resolution and color.  It comes in many different physical sizes from 2" - 3.2" with and without capacitive touch. This version of the module supports input based on the KY-040 rotary encoder.
ili9341e.notes: Pinout: Display - MISO = MISO(Pin 21), LED = GPIO05, SCK = SCLK(Pin 23), MOSI = MOSI(Pin 19), DC = GPIO24, RST = GPIO25, CS = CE0(Pin 24).  Encoder - CLK = GPIO16, DT = GPIO20, SW = GPIO21, GND = GND, VCC/+ = 3.3V

disp_rotation.description: Select the display rotation angle (Usually 0 degrees)

name.description: This name will be displayed throughout the PiFire UI for this probe.  It should be unique to this probe and not match other probe names.

device_port.description: The device name and port where the temperature readings will be read from.

type.description:
Probe types are as follows:
Food - Used as a food probe to track the temperature of food items. This probe will be displayed in the UI and tracked in history.
Primary - Used as the primary probe to control the grill/smoker in hold mode, etc. There must be one Primary probe, and only one. This probe is displayed in the UI and tracked in the history.
Aux - Auxillary temperature input, not displayed in the UI, but tracked in the history.

profile_id.description: The probe profile that will be applied to this probe.

enabled.description: Probe is enabled and visible in the UI.
